IDM 100.courseDesc: This is an entry level course for non-interactive digital media majors that introduces students to the process of managing online content as well as how to define the presentation styles and interaction modes for the user through the use of a content management system.
IDM 100.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 101.courseDesc: This course explores all aspects of web development including the foundations of web technologies, formulation of web standards and how the individual web surfer's wants and needs have changed over time. Also discussed will be ground-breaking websites and the evolution of interface design for the web.
IDM 101.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 211.courseDesc: This course covers the design, prototyping, and evaluation of graphical user interfaces by exploring topics like human capabilities, input technologies, heuristic evaluation, and design methods, principles and rules. We will learn how to design aesthetically pleasing user interfaces, covering important design principles (learnability, visibility, error prevention, efficiency, and visual design) and the human capabilities that motivate them (including perception, motor skills, color vision, attention, and human error).
IDM 211.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 212.courseDesc: This course builds upon the topics covered in User Interface Design I by exploring advanced topics of graphical user interface design for desktop, mobile, and touch screen devices.
IDM 212.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 213.courseDesc: This course is a study of interaction design. You will explore principles, patterns and process for interaction design, define the structure and behavior of interactive systems and how these can be used to create meaningful relationships between people and the products and services that they use.
IDM 213.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 214.courseDesc: Discusses ways of applying psychological and physiological principles to the design of interactive systems, products, processes, and systems to address human capabilities and limitations in ways that ensure safety, effectiveness, and ease of use.
IDM 214.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 215.courseDesc: In this course, students learn to identify and implement the elements required to create incredible digital experiences. Through the application of user-centered design practices, students will develop predictive and enjoyable designs based on a holistic consideration of users’ experience. Topics covered in this course include brand personality, research strategies, content strategy, information architecture, and usability.
IDM 215.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 215.prereqs: IDM 213 [Min Grade D] (Can be taken Concurrently)

IDM 216.courseDesc: This course focuses on taking prototypes from User Design I and creating fully functioning web apps. Students will create and execute a full production pipeline and learn to incorporate User Design practices along the way.
IDM 216.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 221.courseDesc: This course is a comprehensive overview of the design, creation, delivery and maintenance of functional, standards-based content on the Internet. Students will learn the aesthetics of web design alongside the underlying markup languages. They will critically evaluate web design quality, learn how to create and maintain quality web sites, and learn about accessibility and web design standards, and why they are important.
IDM 221.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 221.prereqs: IDM 211 [Min Grade D] (Can be taken Concurrently)

IDM 222.courseDesc: This course builds upon the topics covered in Web Authoring I by exploring advanced web development topics and current industry best practices.
IDM 222.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 231.fullName: Scripting for Interactive Digital Media I
IDM 231.courseDesc: This course explores modern client-side scripting languages that interact with the user, control the browser, communicate asynchronously, and alter document content and functionality.
IDM 231.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 232.fullName: Scripting for Interactive Digital Media II
IDM 232.courseDesc: This course explores modern server-side technologies for Internet based delivery of dynamic content that connect to and manipulate database content. Students learn how to build interactive, data-driven products.
IDM 232.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 240.courseDesc: In this course, students learn how to use modern development techniques to create responsive and scalable two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and dynamic animation. Topics include styling and transforming vector graphics, raster graphics, and text where the implementation takes future growth into consideration.
IDM 240.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 240.prereqs: IDM 222 [Min Grade D] and (IDM 231 [Min Grade D] or INFO 151 [Min Grade D])

IDM 241.courseDesc: In this course, students learn to identify and implement the elements required to create incredible digital experiences. Through the application of user-experience design practices, students will develop predictive and enjoyable interactive designs based on a holistic consideration of users’ experience. Topics covered in this course include brand personality, content strategy, information architecture, and usability.
IDM 241.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 241.prereqs: IDM 213 [Min Grade D] (Can be taken Concurrently) and IDM 231 [Min Grade D]

IDM 245.courseDesc: Examines multimedia-authoring tools used to create interactive games. Students learn real world production techniques as they master advanced game design concepts.
IDM 245.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 250.courseDesc: Students set up a content management system and develop a custom theme. Includes project planning, organizing and maintaining a quality code base.
IDM 250.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 250.prereqs: IDM 222 [Min Grade D] and (IDM 232 [Min Grade D] or INFO 152 [Min Grade D])

IDM 311.fullName: User Interface Design for Immersive Media
IDM 311.courseDesc: This course explores the nature of user interface design when applied to immersive media hardware, including Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality headsets.
IDM 311.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 311.prereqs: IDM 213 [Min Grade D] and IDM 231 [Min Grade D]

IDM 331.courseDesc: This course explores ways to deliver virtual reality experiences via a web browser.
IDM 331.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 331.prereqs: IDM 231 [Min Grade D] and IDM 311 [Min Grade D]

IDM 361.courseDesc: Focuses on creating user experiences optimized for mobile devices. Students learn to build unique web applications that take advantage modern mobile capabilities. Special consideration is given to limited screen real estate, low bandwidth Internet access, no Internet access, and touch screen devices.
IDM 361.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 361.prereqs: (IDM 213 [Min Grade D] or IDM 215 [Min Grade D]) and IDM 231 [Min Grade D]

IDM 362.courseDesc: This course builds upon the topics covered in Mobile Interactive Design I by exploring how to convert web-based applications into cross-platform native applications for mobile devices. Special consideration is given to incorporating functionality that is currently unavailable in web-based applications.
IDM 362.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 363.courseDesc: This course explores ways to deliver and test native mobile application prototypes using IDE’s (integrated Development Environments).
IDM 363.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 364.courseDesc: Learn how to build and test dynamic web application prototypes using event driven JavaScript languages.
IDM 364.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 371.courseDesc: This course explores the developing or redesigning a successful interactive digital experience. Students work in team environments to analyze project requirements, develop a strategy for development, and utilize their design skills to present their findings to the client.
IDM 371.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 371.prereqs: IDM 216 [Min Grade D] and IDM 232 [Min Grade D]

IDM 372.courseDesc: This course builds upon the topics covered in Interactive Digital Media Workshop II by continuing to work in a team environment to building a high-fidelity interactive digital media prototype with a focus on usability testing.
IDM 372.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 381.courseDesc: This course focuses on researching new innovations in experimental digital media technologies.
IDM 381.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 381.prereqs: IDM 213 [Min Grade D] and IDM 232 [Min Grade D]

IDM 382.courseDesc: This course uses an open approach to enable quick and seamless interactions with physical objects and locations via web protocols.
IDM 382.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM 382.prereqs: WEST 107 [Min Grade D] and IDM 232 [Min Grade D]

IDM 401.fullName: Professional Practices in Interactive Digital Media
IDM 401.courseDesc: This course will provide a broad overview of the practices of all areas included in the fields related to interactive digital media, including: organizational structure and roles, client communication and creative process, needs assessment, brief writing, brainstorming, concept development, pitches, pricing, proposals and presentations.
IDM 401.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 402.courseDesc: This course will teach you how to design, implement, and measure multichannel experiences with greater impact for customers, businesses, and society.
IDM 402.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 417.courseDesc: Understanding the user is the fundamental backbone of User Experience Design. This course will teach students how to construct, implement and analyze user interviews in a way that will allow them to gain deep insights into their target audience.
IDM 417.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM 418.courseDesc: Students will learn how to use stories to understand the user, his/her goals and objectives, explain research, and describe design concepts.
IDM 418.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

IDM I399.fullName: Independent Study in Interactive Digital Media
IDM I399.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
IDM I399.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM I399.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

IDM T180.fullName: Special Topics in Interactive Digital Media
IDM T180.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
IDM T180.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM T180.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

IDM T380.fullName: Special Topics in Interactive Digital Media
IDM T380.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
IDM T380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
IDM T380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
